meanings.sent1: When the dog saw the mailman approaching, it decided to skedaddle.
meanings.sent2: The children had to skedaddle home before it got dark.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had to skedaddle when it realized it was in the wrong tree.
meanings.sent4: The mouse skedaddled across the kitchen floor, trying to avoid the cat.
meanings.sent5: As soon as the thunderstorm started, the picnic attendees had to skedaddle to their cars.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers made a quick skedaddle when they heard the enemy approaching.
meanings.sent2: After realizing they were lost in the forest, the hikers made a skedaddle back to the main trail.
meanings.sent3: The skunk did a little skedaddle when it saw the curious raccoon approaching.
meanings.sent4: The comedian's joke fell flat, and he made a skedaddle off the stage.
